ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Selo's Song of Travel
ygData.msgSnippet: My point exactly.  And some were bards on this list. Glass houses and rocks tend to upset me. ... another ... with the subject submissions.
ygData.messageBody:
My point exactly. And some were bards on this list.

Glass houses and rocks tend to upset me.

> I have known some bards that thought they could weave Cloading with
another
> song.
>
> Rokenn
>
>
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Gordon Hughes [mailto:ghughes@...]
> > Sent: Thursday, June 01, 2000 6:56 AM
> > To: eqbards@egroups.com
> > Subject: RE: [eqbards] Selo's Song of Travel
> >
> >
> > >I'm done arguing this thread.
> >
> > Who's arguing? We're discussing the fact that the people who
> > are supposedly
> > in-the-know don't know.
> >
> > He didn't make a mistake; he just didn't know. Yes he admitted it, yes
> > people overreact and flame him for the merest slip-up but by his own
> > admission he has very little idea about issues pertaining to
> > Bards. This
> > doesn't do much to foster confidence in the people who play
> > Bards and who
> > hope that our issues will be dealt with little more than a
> > "Doh! Shows you
> > how much I know about bard songs :)"
> >
> > >Like I said, if you can do the job better, go apply.
> >
> > No thanks. I think he does a great job of addressing a
> > myriad problems and
> > shrugging off more than his fair share of verbal abuse.
> >
> > He just needs to work on his Bards a bit more. ;)
> >
> > -KS
> >
> >
